name: Introduction to Philosophy
description: This course introduces students to the issues and debates in philosophy. It provides an overview of the major areas in philosophy and the tools of philosophical analysis. Topics may include the nature of knowledge, the existence of God, the problem of free will and determinism, and the foundations of ethics.

name: Metaphysics
description: This course examines the philosophical study of the nature of reality and the structure of the universe. It covers topics such as the nature of causation, time and space, freedom and determinism, the existence of God, the nature of persons, and the problem of free will.

name: Philosophy of Mind
description: This course is a survey of the main issues in the philosophy of mind. It covers topics such as the mind-body problem, consciousness, personal identity, mental causation, and the nature of the self. It explores the implications of these topics for understanding the nature of the mind and the human person.
